item.title: Some experiments with Cairo 1.0
item.description: Starkware has recently released the 1.0 version of its Cairo language, a programming language designed for writing provable programs using zero-knowledge proofs. The new version introduces a new syntax inspired by Rust, as well as a host of new features that make it easier than ever to write secure and efficient code. âœ¨ My attempt at Cairo 1.0 I was eager to give Cairo 1.0 a try. To test out the language, I decided to write a few mathematical functions that would showcase its capabilities (GCD, pow, binomial coefficient, factorial).
